alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Northern Wayne; Susquehanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:32PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Susquehanna, northwestern Wayne, southeastern Bradford and northwestern Wyoming Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Susquehanna to near Camptown. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rush, Jackson, Susquehanna, Susquehanna Depot, Springville, Montrose, Dimock, Harford, Hallstead and Hollenback. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 211 and 223. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Binghamton. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
